Course Description: THIS COURSE REVIEWS ACCOUNTING PROCEDURES, AND THEN EXPANDS TO SPECIALIZED TREATMENT OF FINANCIAL STATEMENTS, CASH AND TEMPORARY ASSETS, RECEIVABLES, INVENTORIES (GENERAL AND ESTIMATING PROCEDURES), CURRENT LIABILITIES, INCOME-TAX PROCEDURES IN ACCOUNTING, AND THE ACQUISITION, USE, AND RETIREMENT OF LONG-TERM PLANT ASSETS.
Objectives / Learning Outcome(s) / Major:
IDENTIFY THE OBJECTIVES OF FINANCIAL REPORTING AND EXAMINE THE REASONING BEHIND THE DEVELOPMENT OF GAAP. 
IDENTIFY THE SPECIFIC ELEMENTS OF A BALANCE SHEET AND PREPARE A BALANCE SHEET WITH PROPER CLASSIFICATIONS. 
IDENTIFY THE SPECIFIC COMPONENTS OF AN INCOME STATEMENT. DEFINE THE CONCEPTS OF INCOME AND HOW INCOME IS MEASURED. 
IDENTIFY THE SPECIFIC COMPONENTS INCLUDED IN THE STATEMENT OF CASH FLOWS AND PREPARE A STATEMENT OF CASH FLOWS WITH PROPER CLASSIFICATIONS. 
RECORD AND ANALYZE THE COMPLEXITIES OF COST-OF-GOODS-SOLD AND INVENTORY IDENTIFICATION AND VALUATION.
RECORD AND ANALYZE INVESTMENTS IN NONCURRENT OPERATING ASSETS, DEBT, AND EQUITY SECURITIES.
IDENTIFY THE PRIMARY CRITERIA FOR REVENUE RECOGNITION, AND RECORD JOURNAL ENTRIES FOR LONG-TERM CONSTRUCTION-TYPE CONTRACTS, CONTRACTS USING PERCENTAGE-OF-COMPLETION, AND COMPLETED-CONTRACT METHOD.
Textbook(s): SPICELAND, J. DAVID, SEPE, JAMES, & TOMASSINI, LAWRENCE A. (2005).  INTERMEDIATE ACCOUNTING (4TH ED.).  MCGRAW-HILL/IRWIN.  ISBN:  0072994029.
